column4: not all ipods are the same btw.. so it helps to mention which type you have and what version of itunes you were using

>>>> and what version of itunes you were using

because now your ipod will onyl work on windows or mac
i suggest you look at using floola

you'll find out when visit its website
thanks :-)
but i will wanr you allowing itunes 9 to touch your ipod has severely limited your options

if it doesnt work i can use a windows computer with itunes to copy my library to my external then copy it to my ubuntu computer, then erase my ipod and resync my library from the linux computer using that first program you mentioned, right?
or you could 1) use virtualbox 2) export everything and use rockbox on your ipod isntead (i did this on the 5th gen)
isntead of rebooting just setup virtualbox to have a windowsxp guest operating system
my roommate would let me borrow his itunes and windows to do the transfer
ive never worked with a tar.gz file what do i do with it?
explain. where is the tar ball from  ?
I have the floola-linux.tar.gz file on my desktop, how do i install it now?
tried right clicking it yet ?
lol my bad
i got it out of the tar file as a folder
and ? tried running the floola file?
where does linux put its programs? (like windows uses "program files")
just so i dont have to put it on my desktop
there is no central place. i'd keep that floola on your ipod

it does not rely on anything you have installed on your system. which also means that if you grab the windows version of floola and keep that on your ipod alos then you have a portable cross platform method of dealing with your ipod
but to be honest, i would just dual boot the ipod with rockbox
is your 5th gen ipod the 30 or 60/80gb version ?
120gb

not sure, i havent used an apple product in about 5 years now.
good thin gi keep a backed-up copy of my music somewhere else because floola just flipped out and erased my entire library
ipod
yes?
why is the link to download ipod support for songbird not functional?
use the songbird ppa instead
https://launchpad.net/~songbird-daily/+archive/ppa
what is the songbird ppa?  songbird is very nice, (by the way, excellent suggestion. ;-) )
http://linuxers.org/howto/how-install-software-ubuntu-ppa
https://launchpad.net/+help/soyuz/ppa-sources-list.html
how do i install it from the ipod update i just downloaded from the songbird website?
wouldn't bother with the one from the website. it has problems running on ubuntu. use the ppa instead
im kinda confused by the instructions on the website can you wlak me though this? i m kinda stressed out as it is
1) open a terminal 2) type : sudo add-apt-repository ppa:songbird-daily/ppa 3) type : sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install songbird
this is assuming you dont already have songbird installed, which then means you'll need to remove it first'
is that working for you ?
what is the command-line method of installing (ppa) the ipod add-on for linux 64?
if i wasnt so tired i would be studying command-line more
what do you mean by 'ipod addon'
its not seeing my ipod so dont i need to get the ipod add-on?
i assume so... i dont have an ipod anymore : http://addons.songbirdnest.com/addon/12
what do you use for a portable music player?
my netbook.
lol i need something that fits in an armband
have you tried using rhythmbox or banshee ?
are you sure its a 5th gen because they only went up to 80gb
its a classic 120gb
ok so its not a real 5th gen then.
look at this table : http://www.rockbox.org/wiki/IpodPort#Rockbox_Status
according to that table yours is : 2nd Gen Classic (120GB)
its alot mroe recent than a 5th gen ipod video :)
use the repair function of floola
the db file just probably corrupted
hwo do i repair it with floola?
look in the menus
it doesnt work! is there another way?
floola doesn't repair it when i tell it to, then after says its repaired and its going to quit, it just sits there...i have to force it to quit...and my ipod is still fucked up

there might be if my ipod battery didnt die 3 years after i bought my 5th gen, but since im just operating from 5 year old knowledge through someone that doesnt have a good amount of  experience with linux and apple products... theres only so much i can suggest.
1) mount the ipod 2) look in the folders for music files. 3) rejoice 4) plug the ipod back in to the windows machine running itunes 5) repair. 6) start over with using banshee or rhythmbox
maybe try this in wine : http://www.getsharepod.com/download/
you there
yes
im just gunna run itunes for now on wine...is there a better way to do this?
yes. use rockbox instead of appleod on your ipod.
appleOS*
you mean change the firmware on my ipod?
yes. rockbox has a windows installer utility. makes it easy. it then means that you just dump music on your ipod like a usb hardrive and dnt need to sync.
you can also dualboot with appleOS and rockbox
dualboot what? i have linux ubuntu
im talking about your ipod not your computer.
i dont have access to windows right now so what are my options for better ipod firmware

better is relative term. i used rockbox because it meant i didnt have to use sync software to get music on my ipod. i just used the ipod like a harddrive and rockbox lets you browse the drive like a file manager or it can give gnre/artist/album view too...
http://www.rockbox.org/
http://mikesubuntu.blogspot.com/2007/10/how-to-install-rockbox-and-extras-on.html
ignore those wget steps.
what if i want a copy of my library on my computer in case my ipod is somewhere else or just in case?
i did that too... because i had rockbox on the ipod i just used the file manager to move songs across
http://www.rockbox.org/wiki/RockboxUtility#Download
http://www.rockbox.org/wiki/GraphicalInstall
sorry should of read this in more detail : http://www.rockbox.org/wiki/IpodPort. your ipod is not supported.

yeah known problem. try restoring it with a windows copy then.
7 i think.
but the problem is that your ipod has touched version 9 so it wont talk to any other version

not sure. thats out of my depth.
